00017         /**
00018          * Message Type
00019          */
00020         typedef int msg_type;
00021 
00022         /**
00023          * Message text as expected
00024          * from the Erlang side.
00025          * Must be in ATOM format
00026          * ie. all lower-case
00027          */
00028         typedef const char *msg_type_text;

00031         /**********************************************
00032          * Msg Class
00033          */
00034         class Msg: public epapiBase {
00035 
00036         public:
00037                 static const int MAX_PARAMS = 16;
00038 
00039         protected:
00040 
00041                 msg_type type;
00042                 int size;
00043                 char mformat[MAX_PARAMS];
00044 
00045                 //dirty... but quick!
00046                 char    *atoms[MAX_PARAMS];
00047                 long     longs[MAX_PARAMS];
00048                 double doubles[MAX_PARAMS];
00049                 char  *strings[MAX_PARAMS];
00050 
00051         public:
00052                 /**
00053                  * Constructor
00054                  */
00055                 Msg(void);
00056 
00057                 /**
00058                  * Destructor
00059                  */
00060                 ~Msg();
00061 
00062                 /**
00063                  * Returns the type of the message
00064                  *
00065                  * @return msg_type message type
00066                  */
00067                 msg_type getType(void);
00068 
00069                 /**
00070                  * Return the size of the parameter list
00071                  *
00072                  * @return size integer
00073                  */
00074                 int getSize(void);
00075 
00076                 /**
00077                  * Returns the parameter @ index and
00078                  * its "format" (single char)
00079                  *
00080                  * @param index index of parameter, 0 based
00081                  * @param *format [a|s|l|d]
00082                  *
00083                  * @return 0 SUCCESS
00084                  * @return 1 FAILURE
00085                  */
00086                 int getParam(int index, char *format, ...);
00087 
00088                 /**
00089                  * Sets a parameter @ index
00090                  *
00091                  * Each time a parameter is set,
00092                  * the internal 'size' variable
00093                  * is incremented: thus, if this
00094                  * method is used on a parameter more
00095                  * than once, the 'size' count will
00096                  * be incorrect.
00097                  *
00098                  * @param index parameter index
00099                  * @param format parameter format [a|s|l|d]
00100                  *
00101                  * @return 0 SUCCESS
00102                  * @return 1 FAILURE
00103                  */
00104                 int setParam(int index, char format, ...);
00105 
00106         };

00112         typedef std::pair<msg_type, const char *> PairTypeTextMap;

00118         /**
00119          * Message Handler
00120          *
00121          * This class serves as the main API for clients.
00122          */
00123         class MsgHandler: public epapiBase {
00124 
00125         public:
00126                 /**
00127                  * Maximum length the 'message type'
00128                  * field can be.
00129                  */
00130                 static const int MAX_TYPE_LENGTH = 32;
00131 
00132                 /**
00133                  * Maximum size for an ATOM element
00134                  */
00135                 static const int MAX_ATOM_SIZE   = 32;
00136 
00137                 /**
00138                  * Maximum size for a STRING element
00139                  */
00140                 static const int MAX_STRING_SIZE = 4000;
00141 
00142         protected:
00143 
00144                 PktHandler *ph;
00145                 TypeMap     tmap;
00146                 TypeTextMap ttmap;
00147 
00148 
00149         public:
00150                 /**
00151                  * Constructor
00152                  *
00153                  * @param ph PktHandler instance
00154                  */
00155                 MsgHandler(PktHandler *ph);
00156 
00157                 /**
00158                  * Destructor
00159                  */
00160                 ~MsgHandler();
00161 
00162                 /**
00163                  * Registers a message type
00164                  *
00165                  * The parameter <i>ttype</i> corresponds to the ATOM
00166                  * element in string format.
00167                  *
00168                  * @param type msg_type (an integer identifier)
00169                  * @param ttype text string corresponding to msg_type
00170                  * @param signature (combination of [A|L|S|D])
00171                  *
00172                  */
00173                 void registerType(      msg_type type,
00174                                                         msg_type_text ttype,
00175                                                         const char *signature);
00176 
00177                 /**
00178                  * Generic send message
00179                  *
00180                  * @param msg_type message type (integer)
00181                  *
00182                  * @return 0 SUCCESS
00183                  * @return 1 FAILURE
00184                  */
00185                 int send(msg_type type, ...);
00186 
00187                 /**
00188                  * Generic receive message
00189                  *
00190                  * @param **m  Pointer to receive a Msg instance
00191                  *
00192                  * @return 0 SUCCESS
00193                  * @return 1 FAILURE
00194                  */
00195                 int rx(Msg **m);
00196 
00197         protected:
00198                 /**
00199                  * Returns the signature corresponding
00200                  * to a type.
00201                  *
00202                  * Used during message transmission/encoding.
00203                  *
00204                  * @param type msg_type (integer)
00205                  * @return signature signature or NULL for not found
00206                  */
00207                 const char *getSignature(msg_type type);
00208 
00209                 /**
00210                  * Returns the signature corresponding
00211                  * to a type text.
00212                  *
00213                  * Used during message reception/decoding.
00214                  *
00215                  * @param ttype msg_type_text
00216                  * @return signature NULL on FAILURE
00217                  */
00218                 const char *getSignatureFromTypeText(msg_type_text ttype);
00219 
00220                 /**
00221                  * Returns the ATOM text from a msg_type
00222                  *
00223                  * @param type msg_type (integer)
00224                  * @return string representing the ATOM corresponding to message type
00225                  */
00226                 const char *getTextFromType(msg_type type);
00227 
00228         };
